fees.name: Sending Domestic Personal Transaction
fees.additionalInfo: Funded by PayPal Balance or Australian Bank Acct - FREE; Funded by credit card - 2.6% of the portion funded + fixed fee based on the currency

fees.name: Sending International Personal Transaction
fees.additionalInfo: Funded by PayPal Balance or Australian Bank Acct - 5% of the send amount, but no lower than $0.99AUD, and no higher than $5.99 AUD. Funded by credit card - 5% of the send amount, but no lower than $0.99AUD, and no higher than $5.99 AUD.
fees.additionalValue: Funded by PayPal Balance or Australian Bank Acct - Funding Fee = Free.  Funded by credit card - 2.6% of the portion funded by the card plus a fixed fee based on currency

fees.name: Sending Commercial Transaction
fees.additionalInfo: When no currency conversion is involved, there is no fee for sending Commercial Transactions (i.e., buying something)

fees.name: Receiving Domestic Commercial Transaction
fees.additionalInfo: Fees for receiving Commercial Transactions are taken from the total transaction amount. The fixed fees for each currency are in clause 18.8 of the T&C link provided in the additionalInfoUri field
fees.additionalValue: 2.6% + fixed fee (Wallet & Invoicing Transactions), 1.75% + fixed fee (Direct Card Transactions & Other Payment Methods), 3.6% + fixed fee (Virtual Terminal), .90% plus QR Fixed Fee (Commercial Transaction > $10.01 AUD & processed through QR Code in person), 1.40% plus Micro QR Fixed Fee (Commercial Transaction < $10.00 AUD & processed through QR Code in person)

fees.name: Receiving International Commercial Transaction
fees.additionalInfo: Fees for receiving Commercial Transactions are taken from the total transaction amount.
fees.additionalValue: 2.6% + fixed fee (Wallet & Invoicing Transactions), 1.75% + fixed fee (Direct Card Transactions & Other Payment Methods), 3.6% + fixed fee (Virtual Terminal), .90% plus QR Fixed Fee (Commercial Transaction > $10.01 AUD & processed through QR Code in person), 1.40% plus Micro QR Fixed Fee (Commercial Transaction < $10.00 AUD & processed through QR Code in person)

fees.name: Receiving Fees for Registered Charities and Not-For-Profit Organisations
fees.additionalInfo: Registered Charities and Not-For-Profit organisations may apply for the following special rates for receiving PayPal Wallet Online and Invoicing Transactions
fees.additionalValue: Domestic Transactions: 1.1% + fixed fee; Cross-border Transactions: 2.1% + fixed fee.  The fixed fee rates are contained in Clause 18.8 in the document link contained in additionalInfoUri field

fees.name: Micropayment Pricing
fees.additionalInfo: If you qualify as a seller for the micropayment pricing fees as set out in our User Agreement, you will pay the lesser of the:  Micropayment pricing fees 5% + fixed fee (Domestic) - 5.5% + fixed fee (International) OR Fees described in the 'Receiving Commercial Transactions' Fee
fees.additionalValue: You can apply for the following micropayment fees. These fees apply to all Commercial Transactions you receive. If you have both a micropayment fees-enabled account and a standard pricing account, it is your responsibility to ensure payments are received to the appropriate account. Once a payment is received, you may not request it be processed through a different account.  5% + fixed fee (Domestic) and 6% + fixed fee (International)

fees.name: Australia Fixed Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Fixed fees are based on the currency received and transaction type. These fees are based on AUD as the currency received - for other country currency fees, see section 18.8 in the T&C link provided in the additionalInfoUri field.
fees.additionalValue: $0.30 AUD (Personal Transaction fixed fee), $0.30 AUD (Commercial Transaction fixed fee), $0.05 AUD (Micropayments fixed fee), $0.10 AUD (Commercial Transaction > $10.01 AUD & processed through QR Code in person fixed fee - QR Fixed Fee), $0.05 AUD (Commercial Transaction < $10.00 AUD & processed through QR Code in person fixed fee - Micro QR Fixed Fee)

fees.name: Currency Conversion Fees
fees.additionalInfo: If PayPal converts currency, it will be completed at the transaction exchange rate we set for the relevant currency exchange. The transaction exchange rate is adjusted regularly and includes a currency conversion fee applied and retained by us on a base exchange rate to form the rate applicable to your conversion. The base exchange rate is based on rates within the wholesale currency markets on the conversion day or the prior business day; or, if required by law or regulation, set at the relevant government reference rate(s).
fees.additionalValue: For some uses of your PayPal account, PayPal may determine currency conversion is necessary. For any of the following transactions that involve a currency conversion in connection with your PayPal account, the currency conversion fee is 4.0%:  * Paying for goods or services in a currency other than the currency the goods or services are listed in. * Receiving a refund beyond 1 day of the original payment. * Sending money to a friend or family member such that they receive a different currency from the currency you pay in. * Sending money using PayPal’s Payouts (formerly Mass Pay) such that your recipients receive a different currency from the currency you pay in. * For all other PayPal transactions involving a currency conversion, the currency conversion fee is 3.0%.

fees.name: Chargeback Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Chargeback fees are based on the currency received. Chargeback fees do not apply if the transaction is eligible for the PayPal Seller Protection Policy.

fees.name: Receiving eCheques
fees.additionalInfo: Fees for receiving eCheque payments are based on payment currency and will not exceed the cap specified

fees.name: PayPal Payouts (formerly Mass Pay)
fees.additionalInfo: The fee for PayPal Payouts is 2% of the total payment amount. A maximum payment cap per recipient applies, based on payment currency.

fees.name: Commercial Transaction Refund Fee
fees.additionalInfo: If you issue a refund (partially or fully) of the Commercial Transaction payment, there are no fees to make the refund, but we will retain the full amount that you originally paid us. Your buyer’s account will be credited with the full or partial refund amount of the Commercial Transaction payment and your account will be debited with the full or partial refund amount
fees.additionalValue: The amount of the refunded payment will be deducted from your PayPal account

fees.name: Other - Expanded Use Fee
fees.additionalInfo: In general, there is no fee to open a PayPal account. However, we may charge an expanded use fee to increase your sending limit. This fee is refunded to your PayPal balance when you successfully complete the card verification process.
fees.additionalValue: The expanded use fee (verifying card details) can be up to $2 AUD.

fees.name: Other - Records Request Fee
fees.additionalInfo: We will not charge for records requested in connection with your good faith assertion of an error in your account.

fees.name: Other - Withdrawl Balance Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The fee for withdrawing your balance to an eligible linked debit card or bank account is 1% of the amount transferred, with a minimum and maximum fee depending on the currency withdrawn. Minimum and maximum fees by currency are listed below where available.
fees.additionalValue: Any conversion of your PayPal balance from one currency to another currency will attract the corresponding currency conversion fee in clause 18.10 of the T&C link provided in the additionalInfoUri

eligibility.additionalInfo: The business must be organised in, operating in, or a resident of Australia. Legal Agreements for PayPal Services.
Terms and Conditions. Refer to the shared URL for complete terms and conditions.

data.description: With a PayPal personal account, you can send and receive money, and buy things online and in person. A PayPal account enables you to make payments using your debit card, credit card, bank account, PayPal balance or other payment methods.

features.additionalInfo: Enable customers to pay any way they want from almost anywhere. Let them pay now, pay later, or offer subscriptions or global and local payment options.
features.additionalValue: Accepting Payments from Buyers for Goods and Services (Commercial Transactions)

features.additionalInfo: Move money from your PayPal account to your bank, pay for goods or services online or in person with your PayPal account balance. Or transfer funds to pay vendors electronically.
features.additionalValue: Make Payments for Goods and Services (Commercial Transactions) or Send Money to Friends and Family (Personal Transactions)

features.additionalInfo: Send a professional invoice or estimate in minutes. Customers can pay with PayPal or debit and credit card, and you can manage your invoice payments in a single place. When you request a payment, we’ll send the recipient a notification and let you know when you’ve been paid.

If you have funds in your PayPal account, you may withdraw them to the linked bank account you hold with a financial institution in Australia or the United States of America. If you have funds in your account that are held in a foreign currency, they’ll usually be converted to Australian Dollars prior to withdrawal.
Key Benefits. Refer to PayPal's Combined Financial Services Guide and Product Disclosure Statement.

data.name: PayPal personal account
